body:
If you want AFL Picks every week, for free, from a profitable sports bettor, you have to bookmark this page. 

The big guy is is 16 from 29 so far. He had a cold week nine (we're halfway through round 10 at time of publishing), but we're ok with that. His 20%+ ROI was unsustainable and we anticipate him finishing the season in the 7-15% range. Which would mirror his 13% last year.

Fresh from Australia, our expert (who works at a sportsbook in Australia) has been winning on Aussie Rules for a decade.

Each week he shares his best three bets at the spread. Get them early as the line almost always moves in his favor.

- - -

## **AFL Picks Round 11**

## **Port Adelaide vs Richmond**

Richmond have covered three of their last four against Port Adelaide. As well as six of their last seven off a win, so they look to be in a prime spot. 

Port have covered just five of their last 18 off a win of two or more goals. 

The Tigers are starting to get hot and can be ridden here. 

### **Recommended Bet:**

Tigers -2.5

- - -

## **West Coast vs Carlton**

West Coast have an outstanding record in Perth when heavily favored. 

They cover at a clip of 62% when favored by more than two goals and 64% when favored by three goals. The Eagles beat the Blues by 24. 

The Blues have a shocking record interstate, covering just 38% after traveling outside of Victoria.

### **Recommended Bet:**

West Coast -19.5

- - -

## **Melbourne vs North Melbourne**

This looks a great spot for the Shinboners here. 

North cover at 59% when an underdog of more than a goal. Off a loss of more than three goals, that position bumps to 65%. 

Melbourne cover at just 42% as a favorite and gave covered just three of their last 10 in the spot. 

### **Recommended Bet:**

North Melbourne +10.5

- - -

## **AFL Picks Round 10**

## **Essendon vs GWS**

GWS have a nice record against Essendon and can record a big win this week when the teams meet at Metricon. 

The Giants have won four of the last five meetings and have covered six of nine against the Bombers dating back to 2012. 

Essendonâ€™s only won in their last three was an unconvincing one against Adelaide. 

GWS have won their last two and four of their last six.

### **Recommended Bet:**

GWS -14.5

- - -

## **Adelaide vs Melbourne**

The lowly Crows are just a pure bet against team this year. 

They have failed to win any of their first nine games. They have covered just one. They have a lowly percentage of 56.7. 

Melbourne are 3-5 but have won two of their last four. The Demons have covered seven of their last eight against the Crows and the Demons have covered four of their last six off a loss of 30-plus.

### **Recommended Bet:**

Melbourne -14.5 **WIN**

- - -

## **Collingwood vs Sydney**

Collingwood will be looking to bounce back after a very disappointing loss following their coach being caught in a biosecurity breach that has rocked the club. 

They will be looking to put that disappointing loss behind them in a very winnable affair against the Swans. 

The Magpies have covered five of the last seven against the Swans. Plus, they've covered 12 of 18 off a loss. The Swans have won just 1 of their last 6 with four losses of 28-plus in that run.

### **Recommended Bet:**

Collingwood -16.5 **LOSS**

- - -

## **2020 Results**

Our guru is 15 from 27 so far this year. Insane results.

* Sydney+13.5 **LOSS**
* Carlton -10.5 **LOSS**
* Essendon +15.5 **LOSS**
